The in-wing dual-mode fans are awesome! Well done, Quiznos!

for some reason the lift fan wings are overheating and exploding even at less than 1/4 throttle whenever i use them, do you know why this might be? it's really irritating, because they're so cool and i want to use them.
I really like that mod, keep working!

for some reason the lift fan wings are overheating and exploding even at less than 1/4 throttle whenever i use them, do you know why this might be? it's really irritating, because they're so cool and i want to use them.

Are you using the hover mode? I put a disclaimer about it on the main post. Firespitter has a bug right now that causes them to overheat when in hover mode, so I would just use them as normal for now until it is patched and you should be fine.
Quiznos, stahp. I'm not using your mod because I'm near my ram limit. You're not making me feel good about my decision.

Quiznos, stahp. I'm not using your mod because I'm near my ram limit. You're not making me feel good about my decision.

All the textures are in DDS format now, so the contribution to overall memory usage should be pretty small. If you have part mods that don't yet have DDS textures, look at them first.

Quiznos, stahp. I'm not using your mod because I'm near my ram limit. You're not making me feel good about my decision.

OpenGL may help you stuff in more mods.

Quiznos, stahp. I'm not using your mod because I'm near my ram limit. You're not making me feel good about my decision.

Lol, I apologize . But as blowfish pointed out the mod should use up less space than before

OpenGL may help you stuff in more mods.

Oh -- I keep forgetting about this. Is there a good list of tips at re-improving the graphics quality when using OpenGL?

[edit]D'oh... Didn't notice the link in the first part of your sentence. OpenGL frees up a *ton* of ram, but the reduction in image quality and performance are still taking some tweaking to fix.

UPDATE: I appologize, I had accidentally put a copy of GameData/QuizTechAero INSIDE of /GameData. All problems are fixed. Keep up the amazing work!

I keep getting duplicate parts in the SPH. This only started with the most recent update. I have deleted the QuizTechAero folder, made sure BahaSP and Firespitter are up to date and completely reinstalled from the latest upload on KerbalStuff. I can see no reason for this error, any help would be appreciated. Thank you.

Can I make a request?

Those big glass cockpits are just begging for a TextureReplacer reflections config. This is all I need in my life.

It would be glorious.

There is a reflection config already in the Extras folder

@casnymag

Actually you just copy everything from the 'GameData'-folder into your GameData and it should work fine.

This is correct. A lot of people have been trying to extract the large folder into GameData and have been getting strange results. Only take what's inside [1.x] QuizTechAeroPack vX\GameData and put it in your own GameData. The instructions are in the ReadMe.txt, and I encourage everyone to read them before posting about installation issues.

P.S. Those are some cool crafts that you posted DeepSlayLP

CKAN please....

CKAN please....

Be patient. CKAN automatically updates from KerbalStuff periodically.

CKAN please....

Stop that. You can be happy if someone supports CKAN, but if they do not you should just accept that. It is not the end game of mod support and the constant nagging for it is highly annoying.

CKAN please....

Quiztech Aero is on CKAN, you most likely have a dependency conflict, thus it is not listed for you.

That dependency is most likely BDAnimation, delete that manually and install from CKAN as well.
